channel.title: Error when connecting to my server
channel.description: I used a port check tool and it shows i'm port forwarded, set variables, changed server IP in my client folder and everything, it even lets me put my server on the serverstatus page but yet when I try logging in it still says error connecting to server, any suggestions? will do teamviewer or skype

item.title: Error when connecting to my server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

afterdeath15:

I’m hosting the server from my computer but what should I change it to if im gonna be playing on the server but want others to play on a different network?

Change the IP to the one found here: http://whatismyip.com (Unless you’re running NO-IP, then use that…).
Then after you make a jar and send it out or what ever you’re doing.
Change the IP back to localhost (127.0.0.1) and use it for yourself. Just make sure to send out the client with the correct IP.

Read full topic
item.source: Error when connecting to my server

item.source: Error when connecting to my server

item.title: Error when connecting to my server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

afterdeath15:

It lets me run the server and everything, I’m thinking maybe it is my client.java, how do I have to have my ip’s in there set?

where ever server = “ip”; is (obviously not going to have “ip”)
It needs to have:
If you’re playing locally, from your computer, and the server is running from the same computer: 127.0.0.1
If you’re playing locally, and someone is on the network, but not the same computer: 192.168.X.X (This is network or “local” IP).
If you’re playing via another computer not on the same network: http://whatismyip.com

Read full topic

item.source: Error when connecting to my server

item.title: Error when connecting to my server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“MrSnow1, post:12, topic:528151”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=646902.msg4351271#msg4351271 date=1376683866]
His port is open and nothing seems to be running, if the server runs, it might say there’s something blocking the port… That’s what I’m trying to figure out.
[/quote]

So, ports are fine, server is running, canyouseeme.org is a succes, and 1 error connecting to server,
maybe, he changed the ip in hes client, and FORGOT to COMPILE ?

Else i dont know anything, because nothing can block it,

and my problem was, that i needed to reset and restart the router.
my server is back online.[/quote]
You. Aren’t. Listening.

The image he posted does not have his server running. If he turns on the server and does the test, it may show “Something is blocking the port” error.
Because it’s already open on canyouseeme’s site, and that site only checks if something is being sent out from a defined port…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @MrSnow1 MrSnow1
item.description:
@MrSnow1 wrote:

sk8rdude461:

His port is open and nothing seems to be running, if the server runs, it might say there’s something blocking the port… That’s what I’m trying to figure out.

So, ports are fine, server is running, canyouseeme.org is a succes, and 1 error connecting to server,
maybe, he changed the ip in hes client, and FORGOT to COMPILE ?

Else i dont know anything, because nothing can block it,

and my problem was, that i needed to reset and restart the router.
my server is back online.

item.title: Error when connecting to my server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“MrSnow1, post:10, topic:528151”]If the porforward is correct, and the port is open, and still got the error connecting to server, the problem to me is the ip in your client.java (client side ofc)

server = 127.0.0.1
server = 192.168.1.x
server = xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx ( watismijnip.nl )[/quote]
His port is open and nothing seems to be running, if the server runs, it might say there’s something blocking the port… That’s what I’m trying to figure out.

Read full topic
